VINCENT HEMMING]129-vincent was looked upon by [the professor]308-the professor , by [Jimmie]130-jimmie , by [the servants]1747-the servants , and indeed by [everyone]1994-everyone except [Mary]124-mary [herself]124-mary , as [[her]124-mary especial property]1995-her especial property . [He]129-vincent was , in fact , [one of the few intimate visitors who came when [he]129-vincent liked to [the Harley Street house]1997-the harley street house]1996-one of the few intimate visitors who came when he liked to the harley street house . [He]129-vincent had become part of [her]124-mary grown - up life , having first appeared about a year after that Sunday night parting , when [the world]318-the world had seemed very empty indeed . [His]129-vincent little air of deference was eminently attractive to [a young girl]1774-a young girl , who fancied that [she]1774-a young girl had done for ever with emotion . As for [Jimmie]130-jimmie , [he]129-vincent adored [Vincent]129-vincent , though [Jimmie]130-jimmie generally adored [new acquaintances]2000-new acquaintances — for the space of about six weeks . [[Hemming]129-vincent 's father]2001-hemming 's father had been [a politician of some note , who had twice held office]2002-a politician of some note , who had twice held office , and [Vincent]129-vincent had pre - eminently the manners of [one burdened with state secrets]2003-one burdened with state secrets . [His]129-vincent little reserves , a certain air of caution , of discretion , all belonged to those early experiences when [[his]129-vincent father]1752-his father was alive . To be sure , [he]129-vincent had charming , rather old - fashioned manners , affected the speech of the mid - century , and was carried away by few of the modern crazes or fads . A well - shaped forehead — of the showily intellectual type — wavy hair , already threaded with grey , a short , pointed beard , and eyes of an innocent , penetrating brown , made up a personality which appealed at once to [dowagers]2005-dowagers and [young girls]1937-young girls . At table [he]129-vincent looked very well , although [his]129-vincent shoulders were inclined to slope slightly , but when [he]129-vincent stood up [you]2007-you saw that [he]129-vincent had not the eminently British habit of planting [himself]129-vincent firmly , squarely , and self - assertively on [his]129-vincent feet . For the rest , [he]129-vincent had [a small property]2008-a small property which brought [him]129-vincent in about three hundred a year , and though already grey , was still spoken of by [[his]129-vincent elders]2009-his elders as [a ‘[0-i] promising young man]2010-a ‘ promising young man . ’ Though [a Conservative]2011-a conservative , [he]129-vincent believed in the higher education , even the enfranchisement of [women]1964-women . It was a subject on which [he]129-vincent was persuasively eloquent . It was quite pretty , [ladies]1767-ladies always thought , to hear [him]129-vincent talk of [his]129-vincent dreams , [his]129-vincent sacrifices , and an occasional article which [he]129-vincent succeeded in getting inserted on [his]129-vincent favourite subject in the Fortnightly or the Contemporary was laboriously written in studied English , and with a persuasive pen . [He]129-vincent had a great deal to say on the future of the race , and on the necessity of maintaining a high ethical standard , and [he]129-vincent always waxed exceedingly wroth over the literary excesses of [MM . Zola]163-mm . zola and [de Goncourt]164-de goncourt , and thanked heaven , so to speak , that [those eminent pioneers of Realism]2014-those eminent pioneers of realism did not belong to [the Anglo - Saxon family]2015-the anglo - saxon family . ‘[0-i] [We]563-we are passing , ’ [he]129-vincent announced one day , when [he]129-vincent was calling on [Lady Jane Ives]131-lady jane , ‘[0-i] through one of the reconstructive periods of [the world]318-the world 's history . Art , under such conditions , is necessarily tentative , rarely complete . ’ ‘[566-my poor child] Yes , ’ said [Alison]128-alison , dryly , ‘[566-my poor child] and building , [you]565-you see , always makes a mess . The smoking lime , the dirty puddles , the unpleasant odour of baking bricks are inevitable . ’ But [Lady Jane]131-lady jane , who had knocked about [the most depraved society in [Europe]29-europe]2016-the most depraved society in europe for half a century , and who clung with amiable tenacity to [her]131-lady jane illusions , always agreed with [Mr. Hemming]129-vincent . [Lady Jane]131-lady jane , who was [a judge of such things]2017-a judge of such things , said that [he]129-vincent was [one of [the few modern young men whom [she]131-lady jane could endure]2019-the few modern young men whom she could endure in [[her]131-lady jane drawing - room]2020-her drawing - room for more than twenty minutes]2018-one of the few modern young men whom she could endure in her drawing - room for more than twenty minutes . A day or two after [Alison]128-alison 's visit , [Mr. Vincent Hemming]129-vincent appeared , looking charmingly correct and sympathetic , in a black - and - white spotted tie and a band round [his]129-vincent hat . [He]129-vincent had gauged to a nicety [his]129-vincent degree of intimacy with [the great man who was gone]2021-the great man who was gone . It was a day when outlines were clearly cut , and colours glaring ; everything looked crisp , hard , decided , inevitable . [The rooms]2022-the rooms wore the unsettled , desolate look of [a house that is soon to be empty]2023-a house that is soon to be empty . One or two favourite pictures had already been lifted down from off the wall , leaving a patch of clean paper visible ; one bookcase was already a dark void , the volumes were piled on the floor ready to be packed . [Most of [the library]457-the library]2024-most of the library was to be sold , and [Mary]124-mary now stood on a ladder , running a regretful eye along the next case of beloved volumes , when [Vincent Hemming]129-vincent came in . ‘[566-my poor child] [[My]0-i poor child]566-my poor child , ’ [he]129-vincent said , in [his]129-vincent sympathetic voice , ‘[566-my poor child] why would n't [you]566-my poor child let [me]0-i see [you]566-my poor child before ? ’ ‘[566-my poor child] [I]0-i 've been very busy , ’ said [Mary]124-mary , getting down from the ladder , and putting out a dusty hand . ‘[0-i] There was so much to do . [[Father]127-father 's lawyer]567-father 's lawyer has been [here]568-here constantly , and [everybody]569-everybody has been very kind . [I]0-i had to think of everything , [you]566-my poor child see — of [Jimmie]130-jimmie , and all that . ’ ‘[130-jimmie] What are [you]566-my poor child going to do ? ’ [he]566-my poor child asked , after a little pause , during which [his]566-my poor child eye had travelled round the dismantled walls , and the cavernous shelves of [the once cosy drawing - room]2026-the once cosy drawing - room . ‘[566-my poor child] Of course , [we]570-we ca n't stay in [this big house]571-this big house , ’ [she]0-i explained ; ‘[0-i] [I]0-i 've taken [some lodgings in [Bulstrode Street]22-bulstrode street]572-some lodgings in bulstrode street , near [the Central London School of Art]442-the central london school of art . ’ ‘[566-my poor child] By [yourself]566-my poor child , [[my]0-i dear child]574-my dear child ? ’ ‘[566-my poor child] [I]0-i suppose so , for the present , ’ [she]0-i answered , knocking two volumes together in a determined manner to get the dust from the edges . [Her]0-i mouth had got those little obstinate tucks at the corners now , which [he]566-my poor child knew so well . ‘[0-i] [Aunt Julia]165-aunt julia — [[mother]1804-mother 's sister]576-mother 's sister , [you]577-you know — has written offering [me]0-i a [home]1741-home . [She]165-aunt julia is very High Church , and lives at [Bournemouth]30-bournemouth in [one of [those dreadful little gabled villas]580-those dreadful little gabled villas]579-one of those dreadful little gabled villas . ’ ‘[165-aunt julia] And , of course , [you]0-i prefer an artistic life in [London]3-london , ’ [he]566-my poor child was relieved , distinctly relieved , when [Mary]124-mary announced [her]124-mary intention of adopting art as a profession . Painting , especially in watercolours , [he]566-my poor child considered an eminently lady - like occupation ; it was , indeed , associated in [his]566-my poor child imagination with certain drawings of [Welsh mountains and torrents]2027-welsh mountains and torrents , executed by [[his]566-my poor child mother]2028-his mother with the prim technique of the forties , which now adorned [[his]566-my poor child chambers]2029-his chambers in [the Temple]2030-the temple . ‘[0-i] That 's so brave — and so like [you]0-i , ’ said [Vincent]129-vincent , as [his]129-vincent eye wandered round [the room]396-the room again . The tone of [his]129-vincent voice was vague : [he]129-vincent was evidently considering something which took up all [his]129-vincent attention . ‘[0-i] It is n't brave at all , ’ [she]0-i said , simply . ‘[0-i] It 's an absolute physical necessity . [I]0-i should go mad if [I]0-i sat down to think . It all seems so cruel , so terrible , so unjust . [He]581-he was only fifty - three , and there was so much work for [him]581-he still to do . [He]581-he used to say that an ordinary long life could not suffice — ’ ‘[581-he] The death of [Professor Erle]123-professor erle is a national disaster , ’ replied [Vincent]129-vincent , ‘[123-professor erle] and is not to be gauged all at once . ’ There was a long silence , during which all that this loss meant to each of [these two]2032-these two passed through [their]2032-these two minds . [They]2032-these two had moved to the window now , through which a light breeze fluttered in . [The tall , brownish - grey houses]2033-the tall , brownish - grey houses were spruced up for the season with clean blinds and boxes of daisies and spiraea . [A couple of blonde girls in pink cotton]2034-a couple of blonde girls in pink cotton made a gay splash of colour against [the grey - toned street]2035-the grey - toned street as [they]2034-a couple of blonde girls in pink cotton walked buoyantly along . A hansom was drawing up at the pale - green door yonder , and out of it sprang [a young man in a glossy hat , a gardenia , and patent - leather boots]2036-a young man in a glossy hat , a gardenia , and patent - leather boots . Just opposite [some workmen]2037-some workmen were stretching a red - and - white awning for an evening party . The outward aspect of affairs was unchanged . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i feel , ’ said [Mary]124-mary , gazing at the striped awning , which [the men]2038-the men had now succeeded in propping , ‘[0-i] as if [I]0-i had done with [that world]582-that world for always . And now [I]0-i want to do something , to live . Oh , [Mr. Hemming]129-vincent , ’ [she]0-i added , with one of [her]0-i comic little frowns , ‘[129-vincent] [I]0-i do n't want to be [a “ young lady ”]583-a “ young lady ” ! Do [you]129-vincent really think that , because [I]0-i am [a woman]451-a woman , [I]0-i must sit by , and fold [my]0-i hands , and wait ? ’ ‘[0-i] [You]0-i are very modern in one thing , [dear child]585-dear child ; [you]0-i have the modern craze for work . ’ ‘[0-i] It probably saves some of [us]586-us from [the mad - house]587-the mad - house . ’ ‘[0-i] Ah , but [you]0-i will marry one of these days , and then where will [your]0-i work be ? ’ replied [Vincent]129-vincent , smiling a little fatuously . [Mary]124-mary turned from the window abruptly . ‘[0-i] Let [us]586-us go carefully over the books , ’ [she]0-i said , with a brusqueness which [she]0-i sometimes affected . ‘[0-i] Help [me]0-i to choose , ’ [she]0-i continued , mounting the steps , and beginning to hand down the volumes . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i want that [Lamb]166-lamb and [the Heine]167-the heine , [the Goethe]168-the goethe and the [Jean Paul Richter]169-jean paul richter . Yes , yes , all those . ’ Some colour had come into [the girl]1681-the girl 's cheeks as [she]1681-the girl sat on the top of the ladder and dropped the books into [his]129-vincent arms , covering [him]129-vincent , as [she]1681-the girl did so , with a light cloud of dust ; but [she]1681-the girl looked pathetically delicate in [her]1681-the girl close - fitting , sombre gown , which threw up the pallor of [her]1681-the girl throat , the mauvish tinge of [her]1681-the girl lips , the dark rings round [her]1681-the girl eyes . [Vincent Hemming]129-vincent , whatever [he]129-vincent had meant to do when [he]129-vincent entered [the dismantled drawing - room]2040-the dismantled drawing - room , was fairly carried away by the spectacle of [Mary]124-mary 's childish face and busy , nervous little hands re - arranging [her]124-mary destiny in [her]124-mary own decided fashion . It touched [him]129-vincent , and , at the same time , irritated [him]129-vincent , producing the feeling that , as [a man]1904-a man , [he]129-vincent was bound to interfere . One step nearer now , and the course of a lifetime would be changed . ‘[124-mary] [Mary]124-mary , [dear child]585-dear child , ’ [he]129-vincent said suddenly , in an imploring tone , while [they]2042-they were both startled by the emotion in [his]129-vincent voice , ‘[124-mary] do [you]124-mary think [you]124-mary could — care for [me]0-i a little ? ’ [The girl]1681-the girl turned to look at [him]129-vincent . [His]129-vincent penetrating brown eyes were actually suffused with tears ; a nerve was ticking visibly in [his]129-vincent forehead . It all seemed far - off , improbable , impossible . [Vincent Hemming]129-vincent , [[her]1681-the girl old friend]2044-her old friend , had turned into [this imploring , visibly - suffering man]2045-this imploring , visibly - suffering man . [Mary]124-mary burst into an hysterical little laugh . ‘[124-mary] But [you]0-i — [you]0-i do n't care for [me]0-i , do [you]0-i ? [He]2045-this imploring , visibly - suffering man had flipped the dust from [his]2045-this imploring , visibly - suffering man face and coat with easy tact , and stood , smiling up at [her]124-mary , close by [her]124-mary side . ‘[592-we] [I]0-i do n't know , ’ continued [the girl]1681-the girl , doubtfully , slowly twisting one of the buttons of [his]2045-this imploring , visibly - suffering man frock coat . [She]1681-the girl had come down several steps of the ladder , so that [her]1681-the girl eyes were on a level with [his]2045-this imploring , visibly - suffering man . The nerve no longer ticked in [his]2045-this imploring , visibly - suffering man forehead ; the muscles of [his]2045-this imploring , visibly - suffering man mouth relaxed ; there was already something of triumph in [his]2045-this imploring , visibly - suffering man look . ‘[0-i] Do n't smile , [dear]594-dear , ’ [she]1681-the girl said , very gravely . ‘[594-dear] [I]0-i ca n't bear [you]594-dear to look at [me]0-i like that . Do [you]594-dear — really — want [me]0-i ? ’ ‘[594-dear] Dear heart , [I]0-i have always wanted [you]594-dear , ’ said a changed , thick voice in [her]124-mary ear , and in the next instant two arms encircled [her]124-mary , and two lips were crushed against [hers]124-mary . For the first minute a consciousness of sorrow overwhelmed [her]124-mary . For good , for evil , [the girl]1681-the girl knew that [she]1681-the girl was giving [herself]1681-the girl up to [this man]2048-this man , whom a minute ago [she]1681-the girl had looked upon with the cool eye and discriminating judgment of mere friendship . All the tragic potentialities of [a woman]451-a woman 's life , the uncertainties and sorrows of [her]1681-the girl who gives [her]1681-the girl happiness into another 's keeping , flashed before [her]1681-the girl .... Why , why must it be ? Only a minute ago , and [she]1681-the girl had been ready to face [the world]318-the world alone , to be [herself]1681-the girl , to express [herself]1681-the girl , to work out [her]1681-the girl own destiny . And now it was all changed . Something held [her]1681-the girl against [her]1681-the girl will . [This man]2048-this man — a minute ago [[her]1681-the girl friend]2052-her friend , and now , in this infinitesimal atom of time , [[her]1681-the girl lover]2053-her lover , who stood before [her]1681-the girl with red , flushed face , and looked with longing eyes into [hers]1681-the girl : [this man]2048-this man had already communicated [his]2048-this man trouble to [her]1681-the girl . [His]2048-this man hands , which held [her]1681-the girl two wrists as [they]2055-they stood there gazing at [each other]389-each other , felt like links of iron . In that one supreme moment , [Mary Erle]124-mary tasted for the first time , in all its intensity , the helplessness of [woman]2057-woman , the inborn feeling of subjection to a stronger will , inherited through generations of submissive feminine intelligences . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i ca n't , oh , [I]0-i ca n't , ’ [she]0-i said . ‘[0-i] Do n't ask [me]0-i now . [You]595-you don't — [you]595-you ca n't understand how [I]0-i feel . And [I]0-i do n't know [you]595-you like that . Already the inexorable chain which nature forges bound [her]0-i to [this man]2048-this man . ‘[0-i] Yes , to collect materials for [my]0-i book on the Woman Question . An hour later [Vincent]129-vincent got up , reluctantly , to go . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i have to dine with [a member of [the Government]33-the government]603-a member of the government at a quarter to eight , ’ [he]2059-he explained , ‘[0-i] [My]0-i new article must be finished before [I]0-i start , and [I]0-i 'm thinking of starting quite soon . ’[0-i] ‘ Are [you]605-this man who was going away ? ’[124-mary] said [Mary]124-mary , sorrowfully , turning to the window and gazing down [the street]450-the street . It was all so different now . [She]124-mary belonged to [this man who was going away]605-this man who was going away . Why had [he]605-this man who was going away spoken ? Could it not be as it was ? ... A few yards off [a piano - organ]606-a piano - organ was rattling out a cheap German valse . The sun was off [the houses]607-the houses now , and [the street]450-the street wore [its]450-the street familiar , dingy look . [Vincent]129-vincent searched among the disarranged furniture and the piles of books for [his]129-vincent hat . [Mary]124-mary followed [him]129-vincent to the door . [She]124-mary wanted to say something nice , but [she]124-mary could think of nothing . Just at parting , [he]129-vincent took [her]124-mary in [his]129-vincent arms again , and brushed [her]124-mary downcast lids with [his]129-vincent lips . During that embrace , [she]124-mary thought of nothing , except that [she]124-mary was sure that [she]124-mary had always cared for [him]129-vincent . ‘ [Dear]594-dear , ’[129-vincent] [he]129-vincent muttered , ‘ [I]129-vincent 'm[129-vincent] afraid that if [I]0-i go away [I]0-i shall leave the best part of [myself]0-i with [you]124-mary . ’ When [he]129-vincent had gone , [she]124-mary stooped about again among the rows of books , sorting them mechanically , without thinking much what [she]124-mary was doing . Little clouds of dust rose in [the twilight room]2061-the twilight room . [The tall , grim houses]2062-the tall , grim houses shut out all that remained of a daffodil - tinted sky . Tired and unstrung , [the girl]1681-the girl threw [herself]1681-the girl on to the sofa where [she]1681-the girl and [Vincent Hemming]129-vincent had sat , and presently , to [her]1681-the girl surprise , [she]1681-the girl was conscious that two large , salt tears were coursing their way down [her]1681-the girl dusty cheeks . THE Central [London]3-london [School of Art , though backed by all the majesty of State support]2064-school of art , though backed by all the majesty of state support , was , at the first blush , a somewhat disillusionising place to the youthful aspirant for fame . To the over - nice , to be sure , [it]2064-school of art , though backed by all the majesty of state support lacked an art ‘[129-vincent] atmosphere , ’ except such a material one as is generated by ancient paint - tubes , oily rags , furtively - munched sandwiches , and the presence of a preponderance of [people to whom the daily tub is possibly not of vital importance]2065-people to whom the daily tub is possibly not of vital importance . Outwardly , [the Art School]2066-the art school was only [No . 55]2067-no . 55 , in [a dreary by - street near [Portland Road]34-portland road]2068-a dreary by - street near portland road ; [a small thoroughfare of sinister aspect , in which [the houses]607-the houses seemed to be frowning at each other 's dubious appearance]2069-a small thoroughfare of sinister aspect , in which the houses seemed to be frowning at each other 's dubious appearance . The white blinds — now grey with age and dirt — seemed always drawn ; [no one]2071-no one ever seemed to emerge from those faded , bespattered front doors . It was [a dreary , mysterious street]2072-a dreary , mysterious street , of which , when [Mary]124-mary thought of it , [she]124-mary invariably saw the two ends swallowed up in a blurred , yellowish fog . Inside , [this temple of the fine arts]2073-this temple of the fine arts consisted of [one long room with a glass roof , divided , towards one end]2074-one long room with a glass roof , divided , towards one end , by a serge curtain of bronze green . The walls were tinted a dingy - olive colour , throwing up the plaster Laocoon , the torso of [the Theseus]2075-the theseus , [the Apollo Belvedere]2076-the apollo belvedere , with [its]2076-the apollo belvedere slightly supercilious air , the frowning Moses of [Michael Angelo]35-michael angelo , and the simpering Clytie , with startling distinctness . A small écorché stood on a shelf , and all around , looking like the frozen remains of some monster operating - theatre , were eerie - looking arms , legs , feet , and hands cut off above the wrist . Here , too , were the candidates for the Royal Academy , all laboriously stippling [their]609-they drawings of the Laocoon with twists of bread and stumps ; a process in which [they]609-they had been engaged for some six months past ; while in the other division of [the room]396-the room was posed [a child dressed like an Italian contadina]2078-a child dressed like an italian contadina , surrounded by easels on every side . It was the afternoon on which [the model]2079-the model sat . Painting from the life was carried on at [the Central London School of Art]442-the central london school of art on but two afternoons a week , being looked upon as a kind of frivolous extra which should not be allowed to occupy the mind of [the serious student to the detriment of the stippled Laocoon]2081-the serious student to the detriment of the stippled laocoon . It was a raw December day , but inside the fumes of a charcoal stove made [the students]2082-the students '[129-vincent] heads feel queer . [They]609-they were an odd - looking collection of people , who were gathered [there]284-there that winter afternoon in the falling light . [The young women]611-the young women were of [the lower middle class]612-the lower middle class ; [daughters of [retail shopkeepers , who dressed in gowns of orange or green serge , cut rather low about the throat , and beautified by strings of amber or Venetian glass beads]613-retail shopkeepers , who dressed in gowns of orange or green serge , cut rather low about the throat , and beautified by strings of amber or venetian glass beads , while some , on gala days , had been known to appear adorned with iridescent beetles ' wings , a trimming understood to be dear to [the female artist [the wide world]2085-the wide world over]2084-the female artist the wide world over]2083-daughters of retail shopkeepers , who dressed in gowns of orange or green serge , cut rather low about the throat , and beautified by strings of amber or venetian glass beads , while some , on gala days , had been known to appear adorned with iridescent beetles ' wings , a trimming understood to be dear to the female artist the wide world over . And though perhaps [their]611-the young women hair left , like [their]611-the young women speech , something to be desired , on the whole [the girls]2086-the girls were less objectionable than [the boy]1684-the boy - students , whose linen was not irreproachable , and who used to disappear in groups of five or six during the sitting , to return to [their]611-the young women places presently , bringing with [them]611-the young women a suspicious odour of bitter beer and inexpensive tobacco . [An English art school]2088-an english art school has none of the boisterous , contagious hilarity of [a French atelier]2089-a french atelier . Decent silence reigned , broken only by the hoarse , repressed chuckles of [a couple of [boys]2091-boys]2090-a couple of boys as [they]2090-a couple of boys exchanged a whispered witticism , or the rare , high - pitched , but almost inaudible titter of [a student with ringlets]2092-a student with ringlets as [she]2092-a student with ringlets bent over [her]2092-a student with ringlets easel . [Vincent]129-vincent had gone on [his]129-vincent travels — had been gone , indeed , for nearly six months , and all that [she]124-mary had to remind [her]124-mary of that unexpected demonstration of affection in [the Harley Street drawing - room]2099-the harley street drawing - room was a crumpled letter with an Indian post - mark which [she]124-mary carried about in [her]124-mary pocket . [Mr. Sanderson]175-mr. sanderson , [the headmaster]2121-the headmaster , was [a person who rarely committed [himself]175-mr. sanderson to a definite opinion , and especially to an adverse one . At the next easel was heard , ‘[174-miss simpkins] Ah , a very ambitious view of [the model]2079-the model , [Miss Erle]126-miss erle . Just as well , on the whole , for [the artist]643-the artist not to hamper [himself]643-the artist with unnecessary difficulties . Very good , very good . In quite a promising condition , [Miss Erle]126-miss erle . ’ At [the Central [London]3-london]620-the central london , it will be seen , everything worked smoothly . The advent of [the headmaster]2121-the headmaster was the signal for general amenities . Every daub , every ill - drawn head , and every smeared , smooth drapery received its meed of praise . There were no tears , such as water the upward path of [the student]2127-the student in [a Parisian atelier]2128-a parisian atelier ; there were no ambitions , no heart - burnings , no rivalries . [No one at [the Central London]620-the central london]2129-no one at the central london had ever been known to have a theory to express , or if [he]2129-no one at the central london had , it remained locked in [his]2129-no one at the central london own breast . It had already begun to dawn upon [Mary]124-mary that the whole thing was a foolish pretence at work . Slipping from [her]124-mary seat , [she]124-mary dropped back to the easel on which still stood [her]124-mary drawing of the Laocoon , a drawing which was beginning to assume , as it was destined to do , the appearance of a dotted engraving . [She]124-mary was standing , somewhat desponding and disheartened , before this thing which had cost [her]124-mary so much toil , and on the success of which so much depended , when the door burst open , and there appeared a radiant vision of velvet and sables , and of an audacious hat which only [Alison Ives]128-alison in one of [her]128-alison ‘[126-miss erle] worldly ’ fits could have invented . ‘[126-miss erle] Nom d'un chien ! ’ cried [that young lady]2131-that young lady , descending on [Mary]124-mary , and forcibly removing [her]2131-that young lady drawing - board ; ‘[126-miss erle] am [I]0-i to stand by and see [you]644-you become [a British female artist]645-a british female artist ? [Lady Jane]131-lady jane disliked new fashions in [[her]131-lady jane house]2138-her house , and the general effect , in an over - luxurious age , was somewhat cheerless . The stiff , hard Guardis on the walls , in which [tin gondoliers]2139-tin gondoliers were propelling iron gondolas on [a leaden lagoon]2140-a leaden lagoon , with a background of grey zinc palaces , were but faintly visible by the tentative light of the circle of candles in the quivering lustre chandelier . Between the starched lace curtains stood monster Chinese vases , swollen like vases seen in an uneasy dream . The buhl cabinets had chilly marble tops ; the rosewood tables held vast photograph albums . [Lady Jane]131-lady jane had arranged [the rooms]2022-the rooms on [her]131-lady jane marriage some forty years ago , and it had not occurred to [her]131-lady jane to change them . Then [you]715-you publish with additions . ’ ‘[0-i] [I]0-i dare say , ’ laughed [Alison]128-alison , ‘[0-i] that scandal does n't “ keep ” any better than other things . [I]0-i must n't keep [the roans]719-the roans any longer . Good - bye , [all [you]720-all you people people]720-all you people , good - bye . ’ And sweeping away among [her]2159-the pretty woman rustling silk petticoats the complimentary Slav , [Lady Blaythewaite]160-lady blaythewaite 's tiny head and wide shoulders were seen descending the staircase . There was a pause . [Most of [the people]319-the people]2205-most of the people were leaving . From the open hall door came the click of closing carriage - doors , the word ‘[720-all you people] [Home]1741-home ’ pronounced in the official voice of [the unemotional grooms]2207-the unemotional grooms , and the sound of departing wheels . [Dr. Dunlop Strange]178-dr. dunlop strange was bending towards [Alison]128-alison , talking earnestly . ‘[720-all you people] [Charmin ' rooms]2208-charmin ' rooms , ’[181-beaufy] said [Mr. Beaufy Flower]181-beaufy vaguely , terrified at finding [himself]181-beaufy alone with [Mary]124-mary , whom [he]181-beaufy took for [his]181-beaufy especial aversion , a débutante . [His]181-beaufy eye ran round the rather bare walls , the fluted steel fenders , the marble mantelpieces topped by [their]717-immoral people huge mirrors . ‘ So nice and old - fashioned , are n't [they]717-immoral people ? Should [you]181-beaufy say early Victorian now , or late [William the Fourth]184-william the fourth ? ’[181-beaufy] But the favourite modern amusement of whispering malicious things of [[one]1802-one 's host]723-one 's host or hostess behind [their]717-immoral people backs had never appealed to [her]124-mary , and much to [his]181-beaufy surprise [the fair girl in mourning]724-the fair girl in mourning evinced no further desire for [his]181-beaufy society , but with one of those little manoeuvres which [only women of [the world]318-the world]725-only women of the world know how to execute without offence , [she]124-mary had joined [Alison]128-alison and [the doctor]693-the doctor . ‘ Good gracious ! ’[181-beaufy] [he]181-beaufy said to [himself]181-beaufy as [he]181-beaufy tripped [downstairs]286-downstairs to [his]181-beaufy brougham . ‘ How pert ! [I]181-beaufy do n't believe [she]124-mary 's [a débutante]2209-a débutante after all . ’[181-beaufy] ONE night , about a fortnight later , [Mary]124-mary walked [home]1741-home to [[her]124-mary lodgings in [Bulstrode Street]22-bulstrode street]730-her lodgings in bulstrode street more than usually weary and anxious . Somehow [she]124-mary felt hipped ; [she]124-mary would have liked to creep back , just for once , to [the book - lined drawing - room in [Harley Street]13-harley street]731-the book - lined drawing - room in harley street , with [its]731-the book - lined drawing - room in harley street indefinable air of perfect taste and perfect comfort ; to the little tea - table near the fire , with [its]731-the book - lined drawing - room in harley street silver kettle , its dainty china , and the hot cakes which [cook]732-cook used to make so well . In those days , [Mary]124-mary remembered with a pang , a well - known step would be heard ascending the stair , and [the professor]308-the professor would come in , with [his]308-the professor keen eyes , and [his]308-the professor dear , thin face , and stand with [his]308-the professor back to the fire while [he]308-the professor sipped [his]308-the professor tea and teased [[his]308-the professor ‘ little girl]2210-his ‘ little girl . ’[308-the professor] But instead , [she]124-mary entered [the narrow passage of [a house in [Bulstrode Street]22-bulstrode street]735-a house in bulstrode street]734-the narrow passage of a house in bulstrode street , of which the varnished marble paper , as well as the grained staircase and stiff patterned oil - cloth were worn and stained with age , and ascended to [[her]124-mary own domain]736-her own domain , which consisted of [two rooms]737-two rooms . In [the little bed - room]738-the little bed - room , giving on [a grimy back - yard]739-a grimy back - yard , there was a small iron bed with starved - looking pillows , a washing apparatus of which every article , by a strange chance , was of a different pattern , two chairs , and a chest of drawers in imitation grained wood , with white china handles . On the walls , covered with a paper on which apples of a dingy yellow sprawled , in endless repetition , on a dull green ground , were several framed texts . [A yacht in full sail]740-a yacht in full sail , on the bluest of lithograph seas , was accompanied by the words , ‘ Search the Scriptures ; ’[124-mary] while opposite , encased in an Oxford oak frame , a stout , highly - coloured kingfisher emerging from a colony of bulrushes , faced another familiar phrase . These pictorial aids to piety were the only ornaments of [the bedroom]741-the bedroom , and [Mary]124-mary often smiled when [she]124-mary thought of the delicate silver point drawings that hung on the pink walls at [home]1741-home . [She]124-mary thought , too , of the things that used to strike [her]124-mary as [she]124-mary read , and which [she]124-mary would write out and pin up in [[her]124-mary pretty luxurious bed - room]743-her pretty luxurious bed - room ; the scraps of poetry in various tongues which [she]124-mary would scribble hastily on the back of [some young man]744-some young man 's visiting card , and then pin up , with a slender gilt tack , on to [her]124-mary door ; especially those lines of [James Thomson]185-jimmie 's , which , about a year after [her]124-mary first heart - ache , when all had ended in disappointment , it had given [her]124-mary such ironical pleasure to nail up in [[her]124-mary bed - room]745-her bed - room , to the bewilderment of [the new housemaid]746-the new housemaid : ‘ The old three hundred sixty - fiveDull days to every year aliveOld toil , old care , old worthless treasures , Old gnawing sorrows , swindling pleasures , The cards were shuffled to and fro , The hands may vary somewhat so , The dirty pack 's the same [we]2211-we knowPlayed with long thousand years ago;Played with and lost with still by [Man]370-man — Fate marked [them]2213-them '[0-i] ere the game began . ’ Ah , [she]124-mary could afford to be pessimistic in those days ! As [Mary]124-mary took off [her]124-mary hat and threw [her]124-mary cloak on the narrow bed , hastening [her]124-mary toilet for the evening because of the bitter cold of [the room]396-the room , [she]124-mary repeated these lines softly to [herself]124-mary ; oddly enough , they evoked an image of [that pretty bygone bedroom]2215-that pretty bygone bedroom , of a tent - bed with gay draperies , a fire blazing against a background of Dutch tiles , on which [blue ships in full sail]2216-blue ships in full sail were scudding over stiff curly waves , of soft mats of white fur on which it was a joy to tread with bare feet . ‘[0-i] No , [I]0-i ca n't afford to be pessimistic , now , ’ thought [the girl]1681-the girl , as [she]0-i went into [the other room]2218-the other room . The fire was nearly out , but two gas - burners , which had been lighted by [the maid - of - all - work]2219-the maid - of - all - work , and left on at full tap , had already loaded the air with the fumes of gas . It was now a quarter past six ; [she]0-i could not ask for tea , although [her]0-i throat burned and [her]0-i head ached . No , [she]0-i must wait for dinner , [her]0-i modest little dinner , which was served , with variations as to punctuality , about seven o'clock . [Mary]124-mary threw [herself]124-mary on to the hard sofa , and [her]124-mary eyes travelled round [the room]396-the room . The furniture was old , shabby , and pretentious . [She]124-mary had an idea that there were cheap Landseer engravings on the wall , but [Mary]124-mary had made up [her]124-mary mind never to look at the pictures ; otherwise , [she]124-mary said , [she]124-mary would have had to change [[her]124-mary lodgings]2221-her lodgings at once , and that [she]124-mary did not wish to do , as [the landlady]2222-the landlady was [an old servant of theirs]2223-an old servant of theirs , and would look after [her]124-mary better than [a stranger]2224-a stranger . After all , [the place]2225-the place would do well enough as [a makeshift]2226-a makeshift . It was best , [she]124-mary thought , not to accept invitations from [friends]2227-friends , but to begin to live [her]747-her own life . On days like to - day , when [she]124-mary was weary and disheartened , [Mary]124-mary found it necessary to repeat this phrase in [her]124-mary mind : ‘[747-her] To live [her]747-her own life . ’ For it was all dispiriting enough . Art and [artists]2228-artists , as exemplified in [the Central [London]3-london]620-the central london , were but doubtfully alluring ; [Mary]124-mary wondered if anywhere else [she]124-mary might find the ‘[747-her] art ’ atmosphere of which [she]124-mary had read so much . But anyhow [her]124-mary Academy drawing was done ; it had gone in with a dozen others , and to - morrow [she]124-mary would know if [she]124-mary had succeeded . [She]124-mary lay like a log on the hard sofa , while the gilt clock with the hovering cupid slowly ticked out three - quarters of an hour . On the mantel - piece a long photograph of [Alison]128-alison , in an evening gown , exhibiting a good deal of a fine arm and shoulder , was supported by a large one of [Vincent Hemming]129-vincent , with [his]129-vincent grave expression , and wearing an orchid in [his]129-vincent button - hole . At last came dinner , heralded by an odour of boiled potatoes and frizzling meat . But [the girl]1681-the girl was too tired to eat the badly - cooked food ; [she]1681-the girl pushed away the steak , which was tough and hard , and tried to drink some of the small bottle of stout , which was flat , with a strange flavour . [Mary]124-mary rebuked [herself]124-mary for these fantasies of the appetite ; it behoved [a young woman who wished to make [her]2231-a young woman who wished to make her way in the world and compete with men to indulge in no such over - niceties way in [the world]318-the world and compete with [men]1679-men to indulge in no such over - niceties]2231-a young woman who wished to make her way in the world and compete with men to indulge in no such over - niceties . But a very feminine backache overcame [her]124-mary , and presently [the maid - of - all - work , in creaking boots]2234-the maid - of - all - work , in creaking boots , removed with much clattering the dishes , and [Mary]124-mary was left alone with the firelight for [a companion]2235-a companion . The photographs of [[her]124-mary two friends]2236-her two friends looked down on [her]124-mary from the mantelpiece ; [Alison]128-alison , with [her]128-alison capable expression and [her]128-alison distinguished air ; [Vincent Hemming]129-vincent , with [his]129-vincent showily intellectual forehead , [his]129-vincent weak mouth , and the slight frown which [he]129-vincent sometimes affected . What a long time it seemed since [they]2236-her two friends had said good - bye , first on that long summer day which [they]2236-her two friends had spent at [Haslemere]48-haslemere , and finally at [Tilbury]49-tilbury , when [the great P. and 0 . steamer]2237-the great p. and 0 . steamer had been swallowed up in the greyness of [the wide river]2238-the wide river and tearful sky . Yes , a long time ; but [he]129-vincent had grown more to [her]124-mary in [his]129-vincent absence than [he]129-vincent had ever been , even at the last , for [Mary]124-mary was of the order of [women who idealise the absent]2239-women who idealise the absent . Oddly enough , [Vincent]129-vincent , pacing [the deck of [the Sutlej]50-the sutlej]2240-the deck of the sutlej in [his]129-vincent flapping ulster and [his]129-vincent soft felt hat ( [he]129-vincent was not one of [those people who look [their]2241-those people who look their best in travelling costume ) best in travelling costume )]2241-those people who look their best in travelling costume ) , had seemed more of a stranger than [the man whose letters , arriving by the Indian mail]2242-the man whose letters , arriving by the indian mail , lay beside [her]124-mary plate every Monday morning . [She]124-mary remembered with a smile how fussy [he]129-vincent had been about [his]129-vincent luggage , and how humiliated [she]124-mary had felt when , man - like , [Vincent Hemming]129-vincent had insisted on a last embrace , and , drawing [her]124-mary into [[his]129-vincent cabin]2243-his cabin , had shut the door in the face of [the steward]2244-the steward . [She]124-mary had dwelt a great deal on those last moments . [He]129-vincent had seemed so passionately attached to [her]124-mary ; the whole affair , though it had been obliged to remain vague , had become a solemn fact in [her]124-mary existence . A letter from [Vincent]129-vincent had arrived that morning ; [Mary]124-mary felt in [her]124-mary pocket for the thin , crackling envelope bearing the post - mark ‘[0-i] Calcutta . ’ It was a peculiarity of [Hemming]129-vincent 's that one , and sometimes two , pages of [his]129-vincent letters were indited in a flowing hand , while the rest of the paper was covered with uncertain upright hieroglyphics , which took all [the reader]2245-the reader 's patience and good - will to decipher . ‘[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]542-my dear [Mary]124-mary ’ ( it began)—‘My delightful roamings have been brought to a standstill in this ancient and historic spot , one so eminently suited to the special studies which [I]124-mary desire , in furtherance of [my]124-mary scheme , to make . [You]124-mary will , [I]124-mary am sure , be delighted to hear that on all hands [I]124-mary have had every civility and courtesy extended to [me]124-mary from [officials of every class]2246-officials of every class , and that [[my]124-mary father]2247-my father 's name alone has been a sufficient introduction for [me]124-mary , in those circles in which it is most desirable for the purpose [I]124-mary have in hand to move . [You]124-mary will also , [[my]124-mary dear [Mary]124-mary]2248-my dear mary , be rejoiced to hear that [my]124-mary health has vastly improved since [my]124-mary departure from [England]5-england ; the fact alone that [I]124-mary anticipate with pleasure the advent of breakfast will give [you]124-mary a fair idea of [my]124-mary improved state of health , and [I]124-mary think [I]124-mary may say that , considering the somewhat trying nature of the climatic conditions , [my]124-mary appearance has wonderfully improved . But enough of [my-]124-mary self . [I]124-mary need not say that [I]124-mary am delighted to hear that [you]124-mary are bravely and earnestly attacking those art studies which , with due application , will ensure [you]124-mary fame , and possibly wealth , and which will , [[my]124-mary dearest girl]2249-my dearest girl , be no mean factor in [our]2250-our ( possible ) future happiness . ’[124-mary] [Mary]124-mary sighed as [she]124-mary let the letter drop , and gazed thoughtfully into the fire . It was here that the flowing persuasive handwriting terminated abruptly , and that the upright uncertain characters began . ‘ Had [I]124-mary ’[124-mary] ( it went on ) ‘ no dreams , no aspirations for the amelioration of [the English race]2251-the english race — were [I]124-mary , in short , [a man to whom personal happiness is paramount]2252-a man to whom personal happiness is paramount — [I]124-mary might have spoken more decisively in relation to a possible future together before [I]124-mary left [England]5-england . But [I]124-mary am paying [you]124-mary no mean compliment , [[my]124-mary dear]542-my dear [Mary]124-mary , when [I]124-mary tell [you]124-mary that [I]124-mary have every confidence that in [you]124-mary , as in [myself]124-mary , questions of vast importance rise superior to mere selfish considerations , and that in [you]124-mary , above [all women]2254-all women , [I]124-mary have a sympathetic sharer alike of [my]124-mary ambitions , dreams , and hopes . It is above all in studying the marvellous system of government of [a vast aggregation of [human beings of divers nationalities]2256-human beings of divers nationalities]2255-a vast aggregation of human beings of divers nationalities , of such widely - differing ethical standards as [this great Indian Empire]2257-this great indian empire — ’[124-mary] and here the handwriting changed again to the slanting style and mean- dered on over three crisp pages which [the girl]1681-the girl let fall on [her]1681-the girl lap . Somehow [she]1681-the girl would not reconcile [this lover]750-this lover , with [his]750-this lover old - fashioned phrases and copybook platitudes , with [the [Vincent Hemming]129-vincent who had held [her]1681-the girl in [his]750-this lover arms in [the cabin of [the Sutlej]753-the sutlej]752-the cabin of the sutlej , crushing the breath out of [her]1681-the girl body in the supreme moment of farewell]751-the vincent hemming who had held her in his arms in the cabin of the sutlej , crushing the breath out of her body in the supreme moment of farewell . . . . Of the fine irony which results from the clash of human passion and human ambition [she]1681-the girl had not , as yet , a conception . It is to be feared that [Mary]124-mary , with all [her]124-mary somewhat worldly training , was , as far as [her]124-mary affections were concerned , astonishingly naïve . [She]124-mary was only [a girl]289-a girl after all . And so , in the dim light of [the dreary apartments]755-the dreary apartments , [Mary]124-mary sat and dreamed [her]124-mary little dream . Lonely , tired , discouraged , [she]124-mary clung to the thought of [their]756-their marriage with curious tenacity . [She]124-mary was haunted incessantly by a vision of tender brown eyes , of a caressing hand , of a sympathetic voice ; of a pretty interior with books , and pictures , and soft lamp - light ; of [a man]1904-a man 's head uplifted from a desk , while [she]124-mary held [her]124-mary latest picture up for [[her]124-mary husband]758-her husband to see . [He]758-her husband was not [a judge of pictures]759-a judge of pictures , [she]124-mary remembered with a smile ; [he]758-her husband would probably think [her]124-mary modest attempts masterpieces . Why , [he]758-her husband had even liked the sketch [she]124-mary had made at [Haslemere]48-haslemere , on that last day [they]756-their had spent in [the country]530-the country together . After all , [Vincent]129-vincent and [she]124-mary together would have enough to live quietly on ; if [she]124-mary succeeded in [her]124-mary art , [he]758-her husband might even yet realise [his]758-her husband ambition and enter on a political career . What , indeed , might not the years bring forth ? However dismal things seemed now , there was Hope — that Will - o'-the - wisp of [the young]1726-the young — beckoning [her]124-mary from [the dim valleys of the future]762-the dim valleys of the future . To - morrow , to - morrow [she]124-mary would know . [Mary]124-mary took up the letter again , and bending down to the fire , re - read one or two affectionate phrases at the last . Then [she]124-mary put it carefully into a locked case which contained some twenty epistles in thin envelopes , turned out the gas , and went into [[her]124-mary chilly bedroom]763-her chilly bedroom , where , in the process of brushing out [her]124-mary fluffy blond hair for the night , [she]124-mary told [herself]124-mary valiantly that [she]124-mary was [a lucky little person]764-a lucky little person . THE next day — the day which was to decide [her]124-mary fate with [the Academy schools]619-the academy schools — revealed [itself]766-itself shrouded with fog . By the light of one gas - burner [Mary]124-mary tried to eat some breakfast , but the doubtful allurements of the boiled egg which usually awaited [her]124-mary appealed to [her]124-mary to - day in vain . [She]124-mary had slept badly and risen late ; it was now half - past ten . Already , at [the art school]2066-the art school , in [the grimy little office]768-the grimy little office , the names of [the successful candidates]769-the successful candidates would be nailed up . No , [she]124-mary could not eat ; [she]124-mary must know . It meant so much to [her]124-mary , so much more , [she]124-mary thought , than to any of the others . It meant independence , a profession , a happy union . How many hoped - for marriages [she]124-mary had seen fail among [professional people]770-professional people just for the want of a mere hundred or so a year . If [she]124-mary were good enough for [the Academy schools]619-the academy schools , [she]124-mary felt that there was a future before [her]124-mary . [She]124-mary saw [herself]124-mary , in imagination , working , earning , helping . Putting on [her]124-mary coat and hat [she]124-mary was soon outside in the fog , and threading [her]124-mary away along [the streets]276-the streets to [the School of Art]773-the school of art . Underfoot was a layer of greasy mud . In [the little shops]774-the little shops a bleared gas - light made an orange patch in the all - pervading greyness . At the fruiterers ' the mounds of golden oranges , crimson apples , and scarlet tomatoes flamed with startling assurance against the blurred , brownish - grey of [the houses]607-the houses , [the pavement]2259-the pavement , the very atmosphere . [She]124-mary was curiously alive , now , to effects of colour , to ‘[194-the dorothys] values ’ ; everywhere [the girl]1681-the girl saw a possible picture . If [she]124-mary had passed , [Mary]124-mary made up [her]124-mary mind [she]124-mary would telegraph to [Vincent]129-vincent . It would be an extravagance , but it would make [him]129-vincent so happy . [Mary]124-mary pictured [[her]124-mary lover]2053-her lover reading that charming message from over [the seas]2262-the seas , as [he]129-vincent sat in [an Indian verandah]2263-an indian verandah in a white flannel suit , with a hazy background of punkahs and date palms . Afterwards , when [she]124-mary thought of that day , [she]124-mary remembered that [the hall of [the art school]2066-the art school]2264-the hall of the art school was full of [students , all talking at once]2266-students , all talking at once . At the sight of [the girl]1681-the girl 's expectant face [someone]1680-someone called out goodnaturedly , ‘[0-i] [I]0-i say , [you]775-she 're in , [Miss Erle]126-miss erle . [I]775-she 'm[775-she] sure [I]0-i saw [your]775-she name on the list . It 's in [the office]776-the office , pinned up over the mantel - piece . ’ [Mary]124-mary slid into [the little room]1960-the little room without a word . Yes , there was the list of [successful probationers]2270-successful probationers , written in [Mr. Sanderson]175-mr. sanderson 's careful hand on a slip of notepaper , and pinned up with a brass drawing pin over the mantelpiece . [Her]124-mary eye ran hastily along the list—‘Simpkins , [Dorothy Muriel]186-dorothy muriel ; [Smith]149-smith minor , [Mary Gwendo]en]187-mary gwendo]en ; [Walsh]188-walsh , [Joseph Frederick]189-joe ; [Billington]190-billington , [George Francis]191-george francis ; [Thomson]185-jimmie , [Pamela Evelyn]154-evelina ; [Beadle]192-beadle , [Reginald Forsyth]193-reginald forsyth . ’[775-she] That was all . [She]775-she read it again to make sure , repeating to [herself]775-she , mechanically , [the Dorothys]194-the dorothys , [Pamelas]195-pamelas , and [Gwendolens]196-gwendolens of [the back - shop]777-the back - shop . No , there was no possible mistake . The name of [Mary Erle]124-mary was not there . And so it was all over ... Never , [she]775-she felt , should [she]775-she have the courage to spend another six months labouring and stippling over [another Laocoon]778-another laocoon . [The girl]1681-the girl slipped into a chair in a corner . [Her]1681-the girl disappointment had affected [her]1681-the girl physically , [her]1681-the girl feet were icy cold ; [she]1681-the girl felt , without being hungry , as if [she]1681-the girl had nothing inside [her]1681-the girl , while the voices of [people talking round]780-people talking round sounded strange and far away . But presently [she]1681-the girl roused [herself]1681-the girl and went through [the big room]781-the big room to collect some things [she]1681-the girl had left . Only [Mr. Perry Jackson]173-perry met [her]1681-the girl behind the olive - green curtain : — [Mr. Jackson]173-perry , who , although [the workmen]782-the workmen were now out of [[his]173-perry studio]783-his studio , was curiously often to be seen at [the school]2113-the school . [He]173-perry glanced at [Mary]124-mary and instantly read the disappointment in [her]124-mary face . Though young , [he]173-perry was , after all , [a Londoner]785-a londoner , and had [the Cockney]197-the cockney 's intuitive knowledge of [the world]318-the world . [He]173-perry even went so far as to congratulate [Miss Erle]126-miss erle in having failed to attain the desired standard of academical excellence . [He]173-perry had , as [he]173-perry admitted with pleasing candour , only got [his]173-perry own drawing admitted , in the years gone by , ‘ by the skin of its teeth . ’[173-perry] As for [himself]173-perry , [he]173-perry had mainly attended the classes ( and this was said with something very like a wink ) to make friends with [the Royal Academicians]787-the royal academicians . ‘ [They]2271-they 're[198-old jack madder] all right when [you]788-you know 'em , but [you]788-you 've got to know ['em]2272-'em[198-old jack madder] first , ’ quoted [the rising artist]2273-the rising artist . ‘[788-you] There 's [old Jack Madder]198-old jack madder , who always does [Wardour Street]51-wardour street pictures ; [he]198-old jack madder 's not half [a bad old chap]789-a bad old chap , and thinks no end of [me]0-i . [He]198-old jack madder 's on [the Hanging Committee]790-the hanging committee next year . [I]0-i go and ask [his]198-old jack madder advice . [I]0-i 'm going to do a big thing for next year 's Academy , and [I]198-old jack madder 'll eat [my]198-old jack madder hat if it is n't on the line ! ’[198-old jack madder] ‘ [I]0-i hope so , [I]0-i 'm[0-i] sure , ’ replied [Mary]124-mary , smiling . ‘[0-i] When are [you]0-i going to begin ? ’ ‘[0-i] Oh , at once . [I]0-i 've got an idea that 's bound to fetch [the public]688-the public . ’ ‘[0-i] Indeed ? ’ replied [Mary]124-mary , amused at [his]198-old jack madder naïve optimism . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i shall call it “ The Time of Roses . ” What do [you]792-you think of that ? [Neat]199-neat , eh ? Nothing but [girls]461-girls , and nothing but roses . [Lord]794-lord , [you]792-you ca n't give [the public]688-the public enough of either of [them]796-them . [It]797-it likes 'em , because [they]796-them both “ go off ” so soon , ’[173-perry] added [Mr. Jackson]173-perry , charmed with [his]173-perry own perspicacity . ‘ It 'll be an eight - footer , if it 's an inch , and if it is n't on the line next May — — ’[173-perry] ‘ [I]124-mary dare say it will be an immense success , ’[124-mary] said [Mary]124-mary quietly , as [she]124-mary thought of bygone Private Views , and of the canvases which had become ‘ the picture of the year . ’[173-perry] ‘ Now , for [the Grosvenor]200-the grosvenor , ’[798-mr.] continued [Mr.]798-mr. Jackson—‘after [my]0-i last Academy picture [they]799-they 're spry enough with [their]799-they invitations to exhibit [there]284-there — [I]800-i shall do [a girl in [a graveyard]2276-a graveyard]2275-a girl in a graveyard . Bless [you]801-you , [people]1883-people are “ death ” on cemeteries . Black dress — limp — black hat , hangin '[800-i] on [her]800-i arm — black circles round the eyes . And there [you]801-you are , do n't [you]801-you know . ’ [Mary]124-mary laughed . There was not much doubt about the fact that [Mr. Perry Jackson]173-perry was destined to get on . [He]173-perry had an astonishing facility in painting ; in the summer time [he]173-perry worked at vast canvases , out of doors , in [the country]530-the country , painting with large square brushes , in the approved modern manner . ‘[801-you] Oh ! [I]0-i say , [Miss Erle]126-miss erle , ’ said [Perry]173-perry , detaining [the girl]1681-the girl with a look as [she]1681-the girl stood putting [her]1681-the girl painting things together . There was something of despair in the way in which [Mary]124-mary was folding up [her]124-mary easel , and arranging [her]124-mary chalks and paint - brushes in the long tin box , and with [his]173-perry quick sympathy [the young man]1776-the young man wished to assuage [her]124-mary sickening disappointment . ‘[0-i] Just look here , ’ [he]173-perry continued , pulling from a cardboard portfolio an Indian - ink drawing of [a beautiful young woman in a ball - dress]2281-a beautiful young woman in a ball - dress reading a love - letter . ‘[802-he] Old “ Stick - in - the - mud , ” [he]802-he says [he]802-he 'd like this drawing for Illustrations , only [he]802-he must have a short story or some verses to go with it . Now , [you]126-miss erle 're so clever , and literary , and read so many books , ca n't [you]126-miss erle knock [me]126-miss erle off something to print with it ? ’[126-miss erle] [Mary]124-mary , who had never heard of this primitive method of producing imaginative literature , stared in blank astonishment at [Mr. Perry Jackson]173-perry . [Her]124-mary eye caught [his]173-perry knobby hands , [his]173-perry stubbly hair , [his]173-perry knowing , anaemic , town - bred face , and then the picture of [the exquisite woman robed in tulle]803-the exquisite woman robed in tulle , which [he]173-perry held in [his]173-perry hand . ‘ Oh , yes . Why not ? ’[124-mary] [she]124-mary found [herself]124-mary saying eagerly . ‘ [I]124-mary will try , if [you]173-perry like . [I]124-mary think [I]124-mary could do quite a short story . And [I]124-mary can only — fail , ’[124-mary] [she]124-mary added , a little bitterly , as [her]124-mary mind ran back over the months [she]124-mary had spent in [that odious room]804-that odious room , herding with [hulking boys , who smelt of stale tobacco]805-hulking boys , who smelt of stale tobacco , with [young ladies who tossed [their]806-their heads archly , and whispered anecdotes of ‘ fellows ’[124-mary] whom [they]806-their met in [pastry - cooks]807-pastry - cooks ' shops]2282-young ladies who tossed their heads archly , and whispered anecdotes of ‘ fellows ’ whom they met in pastry - cooks ' shops , or in [the sculpture galleries of [the British Museum]2284-the british museum]2283-the sculpture galleries of the british museum . ‘[124-mary] That 's right . Knew [you]808-you could , ’ rejoined [Perry]173-perry , repacking the drawing . ‘[808-you] It 'll be time enough if [I]0-i have it in a week . [I]0-i 'm doing a story for Illutstrations now . [Blessed]201-blessed , ’[809-i] [he]809-i added , with a comic twinkle , pushing back [his]809-i shock head of hair , ‘ if [I]809-i did n't make an ass of [myself]809-i yesterday . Last week old “ Stick - in - the - Mud , ” [he]809-i asked [me]809-i if [I]809-i 'd do some pictures for a story . “ Oh ! ” [I]809-i said , “ [I]809-i '[809-i] m game , ” [I]0-i said ; “ who 's it by ? ” And [he]809-i says , “ By [Somervail]202-mr. somervail . ” Well , [I]0-i never heard of [him]202-mr. somervail — did [you]808-you , [Miss Erle]126-miss erle ? ’ ‘[808-you] [I]0-i know the name , ’ said [Mary]124-mary . ‘[0-i] Well , presently comes the MSS . , and [I]0-i read it through , and it was pretty tough work , [I]0-i can tell [you]810-you , what with not being type - written , and [I]0-i not feeling quite fit that day , havin' taken the chair at [our]811-our smoking concert the night before . However , a few days later comes a stiff kind of a letter from [this Somervail]812-this somervail , saying [I]0-i must call at once , that evening , at [[his]202-mr. somervail house]813-his house , out [Notting Hill]52-notting hill way . Well , [the servant girl]816-the servant girl , [she]816-the servant girl showed [me]0-i up [a passage]817-a passage covered all over with autotypes , framed alike in white . Well , [he]202-mr. somervail laughed — a sort of thin , superior laugh it was — but [he]202-mr. somervail did n't say anything ; and so [I]0-i got out all right . [Old Somervail]207-old somervail , [he]207-old somervail 's made a good thing out of it ! ’ At that instant a tumult of voices behind the curtain made further conversation impossible . [A girl]289-a girl 's shrill scream was suddenly audible , and then , the next second , the heavy crash of a falling plaster cast rent the momentary silence . Shouts , exclamations , and inextinguishable laughter , mingled with the sound of scurrying feet , followed . An untoward gaiety was evidently illumining the usual routine of [the school]2113-the school . As [Mary]124-mary , gathering up [her]124-mary things , passed through into [the large studio]2290-the large studio , [a boy]419-a boy 's raucous voice raised the joyous , but somewhat incongruous refrain : — ‘[207-old somervail] [The pore girl]822-the pore girl did n't know , [yer]0-i know , [The pore girl]822-the pore girl did n't know ’ — a quotation which may or may not have had reference to [the now triumphant probationer]2292-the now triumphant probationer , [Miss Simpkins , who , with heightened colour and agitated mien]2293-miss simpkins , who , with heightened colour and agitated mien , was bending over the many fragments of the shattered Laocoon , which lay strewn about the floor . The rest of the day , it would seem , was to be devoted to celebrating the admittance of [Messrs. Walsh]188-walsh , [Billington]190-billington , and [Beadle]192-beadle to [the Royal Academy Schools]2294-the royal academy schools , for , scared at [Miss Simpkins]174-miss simpkins '[822-the pore girl] misadventure , [the girls]2086-the girls incontinently fled . A drawing — a laboriously stippled drawing — was triumphantly wrenched from an overturned board , and torn in many pieces ; the easels were as unceremoniously hurled against the wall . Some bottles of beer made a mysterious appearance , and , from [some one]335-some one 's bag , two pairs of boxing - gloves were surreptitiously produced . The moment was justly held to be a supreme one , for , dancing on the shattered fragments of the fallen Laocoon , [a truculent , if disappointed , young gentleman]826-a truculent , if disappointed , young gentleman was heard shouting to [the three successful students]827-the three successful students that , ‘ successful or not , ’[826-a truculent , if disappointed , young gentleman] [he]826-a truculent , if disappointed , young gentleman would fight [them]827-the three successful students all in turn . It may have been the bottled ale , or simply British perseverance , which emboldened [the aggressor]828-the aggressor , for , as [he]826-a truculent , if disappointed , young gentleman threw off [his]826-a truculent , if disappointed , young gentleman coat and slipped on the gloves , [he]826-a truculent , if disappointed , young gentleman was heard fulminating the hazy , if withal glorious , challenge — ‘ [I]826-a truculent , if disappointed , young gentleman do n't care a rap for [[your]827-the three successful students blooming Academy]2295-your blooming academy . Come on , [[you]827-the three successful students fellows]2296-you fellows . [I]826-a truculent , if disappointed , young gentleman 'll show [you]827-the three successful students who 's [the best man]2297-the best man ! ’[826-a truculent , if disappointed , young gentleman] IT was a bright morning in January , with scudding , woolly clouds , showing patches of vivid blue . Sunshine brightened the huge gilt letters over [the newspaper offices]829-the newspaper offices , the crowded , garishly coloured omnibuses , the hansoms laden with portmanteaux on [their]827-the three successful students way to [Waterloo Station]53-waterloo station , the flaxen hair and beflowered hats of [the little actresses]830-the little actresses hurrying along to rehearsal . An ever - moving procession of [people]1883-people poured like a torrent up and down [the street]450-the street ; [journalists]833-journalists , [country folk]834-country folk , [office - boys]835-office - boys , [actors]836-actors , [betting - men]837-betting - men , [loafers]838-loafers — all the curious , shifting world of the Strand was jogging elbows on the pavement . [Mary]124-mary stepped along with a certain sense of adventure . [She]124-mary had to see [the editor of Illustrations]839-the editor of illustrations , but [she]124-mary had no idea of the whereabouts of that popular weekly journal . [She]124-mary had in [her]124-mary pocket , too , a letter of introduction to [The Fan]840-the fan . For [her]124-mary first attempt at fiction had actually appeared in print , and [she]124-mary was curiously anxious to go on . For the first few hours , when [she]124-mary had sat staring helplessly at the sheets of white paper which [she]124-mary had torn into loose pages , neatly folding down an inch border for corrections , [she]124-mary had imagined that the thing was impossible . Then , pacing up and down [the room]396-the room , [Mary]124-mary tried hard to concentrate [her]124-mary mind on a plot — a plot in which was to figure [a young lady in a tulle ball - dress]842-a young lady in a tulle ball - dress , reading a three - cornered note . . .. But [she]124-mary could think of nothing . It was all a blank . What had [girls in ball dresses]843-girls in ball dresses got to do with life — with life as it swirled and rushed by [her]124-mary , with its remorseless laws , [its]844-its unceasing activities ? .. . But yet [she]124-mary must think of something . The scene of [her]124-mary story must be laid at a ball ; that , as [Mr. Perry Jackson]173-perry would have said , was sure to ‘ fetch [the public]688-the public . ’[124-mary] Surely , surely [she]124-mary could invent a love - story ? Yet nothing came . There seemed no reason , in the eternal fitness of things , why [the hero]845-the hero should be dark and faithful , or blonde and fickle , or if the scene should be laid in [the country]530-the country , in [town]1867-town , or abroad . And there was the illustration , too , for which the story was to be written , and [Mary]124-mary , before [she]124-mary began , had grown to loathe [the simpering young lady in tulle]848-the simpering young lady in tulle , eternally reading [her]124-mary love - letter . . . . But at last , after hours of torment , an idea came , and then [the girl]1681-the girl wrote steadily on , with the easy facility of [the amateur]850-the amateur . [She]124-mary had not an idea that [her]124-mary story was like [everybody else]851-everybody else 's story — [her]124-mary way of telling it like that of [hundreds of third - rate authors of fiction whom [she]124-mary had read]852-hundreds of third - rate authors of fiction whom she had read . After the clatter and roar of [the street]450-the street , the staircase which led to [[the editor]2182-the editor 's room at [the office of Illustrations]856-the office of illustrations]855-the editor 's room at the office of illustrations seemed dark and silent . The bare wooden treads were black with age and dirt , and were lighted only by a wan light , which flickered through a frosted - glass door , on which was printed , in gilt letters , the word Illustrations , the first letter having become effaced in the course of years . Underneath was to be read , in black italics : ‘ [[Editor]2299-editor 's Room]2300-editor 's room — Private . ’[857-the office - boy] It was some little time before [Mary]124-mary was able to overcome the scruples of [the office - boy]857-the office - boy — [a young gentleman whom [she]124-mary found dallying in [an ante - room]859-an ante - room]858-a young gentleman whom she found dallying in an ante - room , pensively whistling a sprightly air which was just then much in favour , while [he]857-the office - boy leisurely perused sundry inexpensive comic journals ; but at length [she]124-mary succeeded in persuading [him]857-the office - boy to take in [her]124-mary card . And presently a door was flung open , and [Mary]124-mary found [herself]124-mary in [a small room]860-a small room , giving on [Fleet Street]54-fleet street , fronting [a tall man with a large , melancholy face]861-a tall man with a large , melancholy face , who was bending over a desk . With some trepidation [she]124-mary remembered that [the tall , melancholy man]862-the tall , melancholy man , according to [Mr. Perry Jackson]173-perry , had the reputation of being able to get [people]1883-people out of [[his]173-perry office]864-his office quicker than [any other editor in [London]3-london]865-any other editor in london . ‘ [[Professor Erle]123-professor erle 's daughter]679-professor erle 's daughter , [I]2182-the editor believe ? ’[2182-the editor] said [the editor]2182-the editor severely , without looking up from the proofs [he]2182-the editor was correcting . ‘ Yes . ’[2182-the editor] ‘ Ah ! [We]2302-we were able to make use of [your]124-mary story , though it was not quite up to the mark . ’[2182-the editor] ‘ [I]2182-the editor 'm[2182-the editor] sorry — ’ began [Mary]124-mary . ‘[2182-the editor] The name , of course , ’ went on [the editor]2182-the editor , without noticing the interruption , ‘[2182-the editor] the name counts for something . [[Your]124-mary late father]867-your late father 's name carries weight with [a certain section of the public]868-a certain section of the public . And then , with practice , [you]124-mary may do somewhat better . With practice , [you]124-mary may be able to write stories which [other young ladies]869-other young ladies like to read . ’ And with not a suspicion of the ambiguity of [his]2182-the editor compliment , [the editor]2182-the editor rummaged in [his]2182-the editor desk for some missing object . [Mary]124-mary 's heart fell . Was [her]124-mary story as bad as all that , [she]124-mary wondered ? [She]124-mary was aware that , from a literary point of view , such praise was worse than blame . In the pause which followed [she]124-mary had leisure to look round furtively . And so this was [the office of a big weekly newspaper]2305-the office of a big weekly newspaper ? The walls , once painted a kind of pea - green , were dim with soot , and adorned only with a map of [London]3-london on a roller ; on the floor was stretched a grimy , threadbare carpet . A bluish gas - fire hissed in a narrow , black mantelpiece , and through the encrusted grime of the window - panes appeared [the tall brick houses of the opposite side of [the Strand]2307-the strand]2306-the tall brick houses of the opposite side of the strand . A long procession of omnibuses rattled by continually , and [she]124-mary could see the tops of the hats of [those who sat on the outside]2308-those who sat on the outside . The sole furniture of [the room]396-the room consisted of a bureau with pigeon - holes , and three chairs , covered in cracked maroon - coloured leather , whose legs partook of that especial curliness which was in high fashion in 1860 . Meanwhile [the editor]2182-the editor had found [his]2182-the editor cheque - book , and , tearing out a leaf , wrote : ‘[126-miss erle] Pay to [Miss Erle]126-miss erle two pounds two shillings for contribu- tions during the month of January . ’ ‘[126-miss erle] Pay to [Miss Erle]126-miss erle two pounds two shillings for contribu- tions during the month of January . ’ [Mary]124-mary took the cheque with a heightened colour and a beating heart . It was the first money [she]124-mary had ever earned . This was the beginning . A tinkling of the electric bell was heard , and [the office - boy]857-the office - boy put in [his]857-the office - boy head . ‘[2106-a gentleman] [A gentleman]2106-a gentleman to see [you]871-you , [sir]1673-sir . ’ ‘[2106-a gentleman] What for ? ’ ‘[208-drorings] [Drorings]208-drorings , [sir]1673-sir . ’ ‘[1673-sir] Show [him]2106-a gentleman in . ’ [Mary]124-mary rose . ‘[1673-sir] Wait a minute , [Miss Erle]126-miss erle . ’ [A long , shambling youth , whose face seemed swollen with the toothache]2312-a long , shambling youth , whose face seemed swollen with the toothache , shuffled in , carrying a portfolio of sketches . Not a word passed . It was a strange little scene . [The shambling youth]2313-the shambling youth stood nervously twisting [his]2313-the shambling youth shabby pot - hat in [his]2313-the shambling youth fingers as [the editor]2182-the editor rapidly ran [his]2182-the editor eye over the drawings . ‘[126-miss erle] Thanks , ’ [he]2182-the editor said , re - tying the strings and handing back the portfolio over the desk . ‘[126-miss erle] No use to [us]874-us . Good morning . Top handle , ’ and [he]2182-the editor waved [his]2182-the editor pen towards the door . In another instant [the aspiring artist]2315-the aspiring artist was gone . ‘[126-miss erle] Terrible waste of time , ‘ muttered [the large , melancholy man]2316-the large , melancholy man . ‘[126-miss erle] Hundreds of them a week . ’ ‘[126-miss erle] [Poor boy]528-poor boy , ’ said [Mary]124-mary , who had seen [his]2316-the large , melancholy man disappointed face . ‘[528-poor boy] Pooh , ’ rejoined [the editor]2182-the editor , frowning ; ‘[126-miss erle] what [we]874-us want are well - known names ; [the public]688-the public likes a name , ’ and apparently with an eye to that section of it which had sat at the feet of [Professor Erle]123-professor erle , [he]2182-the editor added abruptly , ‘[874-us] [We]874-us will consider anything else [you]877-you may care to submit to [us]874-us , [Miss Erle]126-miss erle . ’ ‘[126-miss erle] Oh , thank [you]878-you , ’ said [Mary]124-mary , ‘[878-you] [I]0-i should like to try again , ’ and , treading on air , [she]124-mary made [her]124-mary way out , followed by the now admiring glance of [the office - boy , who was not accustomed to see people detained in [the editorial sanctum]2319-the editorial sanctum so long]2318-the office - boy , who was not accustomed to see people detained in the editorial sanctum so long . [The girl]1681-the girl was inordinately proud of [her]1681-the girl cheque for two guineas . How much better , after all , than stippling eternally at [the Discobolus]55-the discobolus — for it was the Discobolus this time , with which [she]1681-the girl was to try [her]1681-the girl fate at [the Academy schools]619-the academy schools — in the dubious atmosphere of [the art school]2066-the art school . The story had taken four days to write . There were three hundred and sixty - five days in a year , so that by writing a story or an article every four days [she]1681-the girl could earn something like two hundred a year ! And what lots of papers there were ! [Fleet Street]54-fleet street was full of them . [They]2323-they lurked up [alleys]2324-alleys and in [quaint little squares at the back]2325-quaint little squares at the back . Here [they]2323-they were : [The Daily Telegraph]2326-the daily telegraph , [The Observer]2327-the observer , The Graphic , The Illustrated London News . Why should [she]124-mary not walk in and demand some work to do ? The idea was fearfully alluring . [She]124-mary passed a poster of Illustrations , with the name of [her]124-mary story in bright blue print , and [Mary]124-mary stood still and read it over and over again with a quickened pulse , until [she]124-mary was pushed aside by the tide of [human beings]2097-human beings eddying along [the street]450-the street . But at present , [she]124-mary recollected , [she]124-mary had to find [The Fan]209-the fan . After many inquiries , [Mary]124-mary found that [the office]776-the office was located in [a huge building in one of [the queer little squares out of [Fleet Street]54-fleet street]2332-the queer little squares out of fleet street]2331-a huge building in one of the queer little squares out of fleet street , and that [it]2331-a huge building in one of the queer little squares out of fleet street was only one of many magazines and newspapers published by [the same firm]2333-the same firm . It proved to be [a little world]2334-a little world in itself , this vast bee - hive , for the printing , publishing , and editing of some dozen magazines and journals were all conducted on [the premises]2335-the premises . There was a deafening whirr of machinery which reminded [the girl]1681-the girl vaguely of international exhibitions , and at every turn [she]124-mary saw [[an editor]338-an editor 's room]2338-an editor 's room , with the name of the journal printed in fat , assertive black type . [She]124-mary was wafted down [long corridors of frosted glass]2339-long corridors of frosted glass — frosted glass , it seemed to [Mary]124-mary , was inseparably connected with journalism — until [she]124-mary was shown into [a small room]860-a small room containing a bare , mahogany table , three chairs , and a framed lithograph of [a young person in pink muslin]2341-a young person in pink muslin , ogling [the spectator]2342-the spectator over a diaphanous fan . ‘[2182-the editor] [The editor]2182-the editor , ’ said [the man in a kind of [commissionaire]2344-commissionaire]2343-the man in a kind of commissionaire 's uniform , who accompanied [her]124-mary , ‘[2182-the editor] [the editor]2182-the editor is engaged on business , but will [you]881-you kindly wait ? ’ And [Mary]124-mary waited . In [the next room]2345-the next room [she]124-mary could hear , in a muffled way , the voices of [that functionary]2346-that functionary and [[his]2346-that functionary visitor]2347-his visitor . It was high midsummer now ; there was a velvety smoothness on [the trim lawns]2404-the trim lawns , the green light filtered through a canopy of broad chestnut leaves , and the beds were odorous with heliotrope , purple with pansies , and aglow with geraniums .
