[MARY]273-mary walked rapidly round [the Regent 's Park]2401-the regent 's park . Over yonder , where the sombre trees massed themselves against the pale evening sky , came the sounds and scents of the on - coming summer ; [children]1595-children 's shrill voices calling to each other near [the ornamental water]1596-the ornamental water ; the tread of [sweethearts]1597-sweethearts ' feet on the gravel path ; the delicate aroma of newly - cut grass . All around [her]273-mary were simple human joys . But they were not for [her]273-mary . [She]273-mary had left all that behind [her]273-mary in [that little room in [Bulstrode Street]22-bulstrode street]3211-that little room in bulstrode street , where sat [the one man in [the world]318-the world that [she]273-mary cared for]3212-the one man in the world that she cared for — [the one man now who cared for [her]273-mary]3214-the one man now who cared for her . There was [no one else]718-no one else ; there never could be [any one else]3216-any one else . But it behoved [her]273-mary henceforward to be sensible — to be strong for both of [them]3217-them . [She]273-mary must never see [him]3212-the one man in the world that she cared for again , must , above all , try and think of [Vincent]129-vincent as [she]273-mary used to do , before that afternoon in [Harley Street]13-harley street — how many years ago now?—when [he]3212-the one man in the world that she cared for had first made love to [her]273-mary , and asked [her]273-mary to wait for [him]3212-the one man in the world that she cared for . How it spoiled everything — this eternal question of sex ! It was almost impossible for [a woman]451-a woman to see [a man]1904-a man as [he]1904-a man really is . And , in pursuance of the plan of being sensible , [she]273-mary went deliberately over [Hemming]129-vincent 's faults . They were obvious enough . [He]129-vincent was weak , vacillating ; [his]129-vincent phrases were absurd . [His]129-vincent ambitions , after all , were but vulgar ones , and [he]129-vincent had not the will - power to carry out even [his]129-vincent most cherished plans . [He]129-vincent was all that , and yet [he]129-vincent was [the only man in [the world]318-the world that [she]273-mary loved]3220-the only man in the world that she loved — [the only man in [the world]318-the world now who desired [her]273-mary as [a woman]451-a woman]3222-the only man in the world now who desired her as a woman . And yet [she]273-mary must walk on , get as far away from [him]129-vincent as possible . Here , at [the North Gate]117-the north gate , the slim young poplars detached themselves tremblingly against the pinkish sky , while in front of [her]273-mary stretched [the long , white [Avenue Road]118-avenue road]3225-the long , white avenue road , with [[its]3225-the long , white avenue road substantial , scrupulously - kept houses]3226-its substantial , scrupulously - kept houses , holding [themselves]3226-its substantial , scrupulously - kept houses aloof in [their leafy gardens]3227-their leafy gardens . [She]273-mary would walk on until [she]273-mary came to [Hampstead]119-hampstead . Up there , there was space , distance ; [one]1802-one 's horizon opened out . Over the garden walls swayed the waxen , pinkish lilac . The scent struck [her]273-mary like a blow ; [that room where [they]3230-they had been together]3229-that room where they had been together had been filled with the same penetrating , sensuous odour . Pink lilac and foliage made artificial - looking by the yellow light of a gas - lamp — how they always reminded [her]273-mary of [Paris]14-paris : of [Paris]14-paris , where [they]3230-they might have been on [their]3230-they way by now . But [she]273-mary was walking alone , steeling [her]273-mary heart against [him]3231-him , in [a road in [a London suburb]3233-a london suburb]3232-a road in a london suburb . On each side was the prosperous , orderly , contented life of [the middle - class]3234-the middle - class , with its placid domesticity , [its]3234-the middle - class unemotional joys . From the open window of [a long drawing - room]3235-a long drawing - room came the sound of [a young girl]1774-a young girl 's thread - like voice . [Upstairs]1832-upstairs , in [the nursery]3238-the nursery , the lights were already lowered . [The white street]3239-the white street was deserted . But suddenly , from one of the open gateways , appeared a pair of sleek chestnuts . [The carriage]2132-the carriage passed out , and , as [Mary]273-mary stood waiting at [the curb]1190-the curb , [a man]1904-a man and [a woman]451-a woman 's smiling faces were photographed on [her]273-mary brain . [A prosperous , middle - aged couple]3244-a prosperous , middle - aged couple , going out to a placid evening 's amusement . Then silence again . [The girl]1681-the girl pushed on , past endless rows of [houses]3246-houses , [trim , smug dwellings]3247-trim , smug dwellings , every one of which represented [the Family]3248-the family — that special product of civilisation for which [she]1681-the girl , as [an individual]3249-an individual , was to be sacrificed .... On and on , until at last , through [a dark , leafy lane]3250-a dark , leafy lane , [she]1681-the girl emerged on [the open heath]3251-the open heath . The after - glow of a crimson sunset still hung in the west . [The Surrey Hills]71-the surrey hills were faintly blue , and [the heath]3252-the heath , with [its]3252-the heath broken ridges topped with gorse and bracken , swept in superb lines at [her]1681-the girl feet . The air was very still . Over yonder a mysterious hand had hung a silver sickle in the pale twilight sky . [Mary]273-mary sank tired on to a seat . But presently [two vague figures]3253-two vague figures approached in the growing darkness — the figures of [a girl]289-a girl and [a young man]910-a young man , [working people]3256-working people both , who sat awkwardly down at the other end of the bench , and talked in jerky , constrained whispers . [The girl]1681-the girl 's eyes were bent demurely on [her]1681-the girl lap , but once , when [Mary]273-mary turned [her]273-mary head in [their]3253-two vague figures direction , [she]273-mary could see that [the young man]1776-the young man 's eyes were devouring the face of [[his]1776-the young man shabby little companion]3259-his shabby little companion with a passionate glance . Something tightened at [Mary]273-mary 's throat . Why to - night , of all nights , must [she]273-mary be reminded of what [she]273-mary was giving up ? [She]273-mary got up , and began to walk rapidly homewards . ‘[1597-sweethearts] [I]0-i was not wanted [there]284-there ; [I]0-i was spoiling [their]1599-their evening , ’ [she]273-mary thought . ‘[0-i] [I]0-i must learn to be discreet . ’ With some trepidation [she]273-mary rang the bell of [[her]273-mary lodgings]2221-her lodgings . ‘[0-i] When did [Mr. Hemming]129-vincent go ? ’ [she]273-mary asked . ‘[129-vincent] About eight o'clock , [miss]1600-miss . Will [you]1600-miss have some dinner ? ’ ‘[1600-miss] No , thanks , [Sarah]227-sarah . [I]0-i ca n't eat anything to - night . [I]0-i 've got one of [my]0-i headaches . ’ [Mary]273-mary went straight into [the little study]3261-the little study and shut the door . Outwardly nothing was changed . The air was full of [his]129-vincent presence . There were the tea - cups out of which [they]1599-their had drunk ; the chair at the writing - table was still half swung round , just as [Vincent Hemming]129-vincent had left [it]3262-it . It was here , just at the mantelpiece , that [he]129-vincent had taken [her]273-mary into [his]129-vincent arms and said all those mad things . [She]273-mary went deliberately over the scene , repeating in [her]273-mary mind everything [he]129-vincent had said . On the sofa the cushions were still tumbled where [he]129-vincent had sat and sobbed . Ah , for once , [she]273-mary had made [him]129-vincent suffer . [She]273-mary flung [herself]273-mary down , clenching [her]273-mary fists , with [her]273-mary face against the silken cushions . [Her]273-mary other self revolted against the injustice of human laws . [The woman within [her]273-mary]3263-the woman within her cried aloud in the darkness . What had [she]273-mary done that [she]273-mary was always to be sacrificed ? Why was [she]273-mary to miss the best that life has to offer ? [She]273-mary lay there a long time , miserable , stricken , helpless . Then , going into [[her]273-mary bedroom]379-her bedroom [she]273-mary began to take off [her]273-mary dress mechanically and to unloosen [her]273-mary hair . Half - dressed as [she]273-mary was , [she]273-mary flung [herself]273-mary on the bed ; [she]273-mary was tired and footsore with [her]273-mary long walk . For an hour [she]273-mary fell into a fitful sleep . The night was warm , but [she]273-mary could hear the flapping of the window - blind , swaying in a light breeze . [Mary]273-mary lay there a long time , every nerve in [her]273-mary body quivering . How long , how long the night was ! Would it never end , never be daylight , when [she]273-mary could get up and work again ? To work was to forget . If only [she]273-mary could keep strong and not worry too much . [She]273-mary got up presently , weary with lying awake , and lit a couple of candles on the dressing - table . The flapping - blind got on [her]273-mary nerves . [She]273-mary had forgotten to wind up [her]273-mary watch , but , from the curious hush in the air , [Mary]273-mary thought it must be nearing dawn . Then [she]273-mary began to pace [the room]396-the room mechanically . Would the night never end ? In the mirror on the dressing - table [she]273-mary caught sight of [herself]273-mary as [she]273-mary passed . [Her]273-mary fair hair was floating in a kind of halo round [her]273-mary head ; [her]273-mary bare arms and shoulders emerged from the whiteness of [her]273-mary bodice . How the eyes looked at [her]273-mary — hauntingly , appealingly — from out of a pathetic little face . [She]273-mary slipped into the chair at the table , and leaning [her]273-mary face on [her]273-mary hands , looked gravely at the mirror . For a long time now [she]273-mary had had a strange sense of dual individuality . When [she]273-mary looked in the glass [a woman]451-a woman looked back at [her]273-mary with reproachful , haunting eyes . And to - night [the woman]1772-the woman looked at [her]273-mary appealingly . By the soft candle - light the face was curiously young . The cheeks were delicately thin , but the lips were those of [a girl of eighteen]3268-a girl of eighteen ; in the fluffy , fair head the few grey hairs were lost among the pale gold . There was the line of [her]273-mary throat , [her]273-mary beautiful white shoulders , the delicate modelling of [her]273-mary satiny arms . And , as [she]273-mary looked , [the woman in the glass]3269-the woman in the glass softened with a triumphant smile . ‘[1601-you] [You]1601-you may torture [me]0-i , starve [me]0-i , but [you]1601-you can not make [me]0-i unlovable . [He]1602-he loves [me]0-i ! ’ smiled [the woman]1772-the woman . ‘[1602-he] Why , [he]1602-he would ruin [himself]1602-he to - morrow for [me]0-i . [I]0-i have only to say one word , and [his]1602-he life is [mine]0-i . What are [we]1603-we two , after all ? Two atoms of matter , breathing , living , loving , suffering for one brief moment on a planet which was once without organic life , and which is slowly grinding on to irreparable decay . A few more drops in [the ocean of eternity]1604-the ocean of eternity , and [we]1603-we and [our]1603-we little loves and little hates will be forgotten . A few more drops , and [mankind itself]1605-mankind itself will have disappeared , and once more [a cold , uninhabited globe]1606-a cold , uninhabited globe will continue its monotonous course round the sun . [No one]2071-no one can stop the coming of the “ Great Year . ” [Nature]274-nature — insolent , triumphant nature — cares nothing for [the individual]1608-the individual . Summer and winter , seedtime and harvest will come and go in the ages to come , but [I]0-i — [I]0-i shall not be [here]568-here . [Nestlings]275-nestlings will crouch , chirruping , under the eaves ; there will be dew on [the meadow]1610-the meadow - sweet , sunshine in [the orchard]1611-the orchard ; there will be [lovers]1612-lovers ' glances , and the laughter of [little children]3271-little children . But for [me]1612-lovers , for [me]1612-lovers it will all be dark . Yet [we]1603-we do have the present moment ; let [us]1603-we keep it and hold it . [We]1603-we are alive now . [We]1603-we love [each other]389-each other . Give [him]3273-him to [me]1612-lovers ! Only a few short years am [I]1612-lovers here , ’[1612-lovers] pleaded the haunting eyes : ‘ [I]1612-lovers , and such as [I]1612-lovers , tearing [our]1603-we little hands in the search for gold , shaking them at the heavens with impotent vengeance . Give [him]3273-him to [me]1612-lovers , give [him]3273-him to [me]1612-lovers ! The inexorable years — the years which fade and blight — will pass over [us]1603-we , and then [our]1603-we “ folly ” will be forgotten . Why , [people in the next generation]3274-people in the next generation will shrug [their]3274-people in the next generation shoulders and say , “ After all , [they]3274-people in the next generation were only human . ” And [I]1612-lovers , ’[1612-lovers] pleaded [the woman in the glass]3269-the woman in the glass , ‘ [I]1612-lovers shall have lived . ’[1612-lovers] [Mary]273-mary dropped [her]273-mary head on [her]273-mary arms . The night was mysteriously still . The breeze had dropped , and an uncanny silence hung about [the house]316-the house . The window was shut now , the blind drawn . The two candles on the dressing - table were burning low in their sockets . When [she]273-mary raised [her]273-mary head again , the eyes were no longer triumphant , they were reproachful . ‘ Who am [I]1615-i ? Why am [I]1615-i here ? ’[1615-i] [they]1615-i asked : ‘ To live is to suffer ; why do [you]1612-lovers let [me]3269-the woman in the glass live ? Must [I]3269-the woman in the glass go on looking back at [you]1612-lovers until [my]3269-the woman in the glass eyes are faded , [my]3269-the woman in the glass lashes are grey , until [I]3269-the woman in the glass have run through the gamut of mental and physical pain ? [I]3269-the woman in the glass am [a living , suffering entity]3275-a living , suffering entity , ’[3269-the woman in the glass] said [the woman in the glass]3269-the woman in the glass , ‘ in a world of artificial laws ; of laws made for [man]370-man 's convenience and pleasure , not for [mine]3269-the woman in the glass . Have [I]3269-the woman in the glass one thing for which [I]3269-the woman in the glass have longed ? Have [I]3269-the woman in the glass a human love , have [I]3269-the woman in the glass the hope of immortality , have [I]3269-the woman in the glass even tasted the intoxication of achievement ? Human life is but a moment in the æons of time , and yet one little human lifetime contains an eternity of suffering . Why , since [you]3277-you take joy from [me]3269-the woman in the glass , why do [you]3277-you let [me]3269-the woman in the glass live ? ’[3269-the woman in the glass] Here , indeed , was a greater temptation than the one from which [she]3269-the woman in the glass had just escaped . [She]3269-the woman in the glass sprang up , horrified , afraid of the haunting eyes .... Was that to be the end ? Pacing [the room]396-the room , [Mary]273-mary fell to thinking of [[her]273-mary father]1846-her father ; of [the kind - eyed enthusiast who , in [his]1846-her father younger years at least , had little enough joy , and much toil , who had been blamed and reviled and stoned by [the public]688-the public , and who had worked solely and single - heartedly for truth 's sake]1619-the kind - eyed enthusiast who , in his younger years at least , had little enough joy , and much toil , who had been blamed and reviled and stoned by the public , and who had worked solely and single - heartedly for truth 's sake . ‘ To strive , to seek , to find , and not to yield , ’[273-mary] [she]273-mary suddenly said aloud . It was a line [she]273-mary had engraved on [[[her]273-mary father]1846-her father 's tomb at [Highgate]4-highgate]1622-her father 's tomb at highgate , a favourite line of [his]1846-her father , of [that dear worker of whom , even to think]1623-that dear worker of whom , even to think , was morally bracing . Yes — ‘ It may be that [the gulfs]3278-the gulfs will wash [us]3279-us down , It may be [we]3279-us shall touch the Happy Isles; .... but something ere [I]273-mary end — Some work of noble note may yet be done , ’[273-mary] repeated [Mary]273-mary deliberately , as [she]273-mary walked into [the little study]3261-the little study , pulled up the blind and raised the sash . OUTSIDE was the wan light of a wet daybreak . A thin rain flipped [her]273-mary face , cooling [her]273-mary feverish cheeks . The gas - lamps already took on an orange hue , and in the east there flickered a streak of mysterious light . A faint chirruping of birds began , though [London]3-london still lay mute , but soon the bird - chorus waxed louder , more shrill , more persistent . The terrible night was over . The dawn was at hand . [Mary]273-mary lit [her]273-mary lamp and searched about among [her]273-mary papers for the chapter of [her]273-mary novel at which [she]273-mary had been at work yesterday before [Vincent]129-vincent came . [She]273-mary had still to do another happy ending , the rapturous finale which [the public]688-the public demanded . [She]273-mary tried to fix [her]273-mary thoughts , but the great bunch of pinkish lilac irritated [her]273-mary with its dominant , sensuous odour . Taking the dripping stalks in [her]273-mary hand [she]273-mary went to the open window and let them drop gently on [the pavement below]1626-the pavement below . And then , there was something thing else — the large , full - length , faded photograph of [Vincent Hemming]129-vincent , which stood just above the pigeon - holes on [her]273-mary desk . Raising the short silk curtain which hid the grate in the summer - time , [Mary]273-mary placed the photograph upright in the fireplace and lit it with a match . Then [she]273-mary sat down on the fur rug , in [her]273-mary dressing - gown , and , hunched up , with [her]273-mary chin on [her]273-mary knees , watched the holocaust . There was neither sorrow , love , nor anger in the grey eyes , nothing but a kind of curiosity . But the stiff cardboard would not burn . [Mary]273-mary lit it twice with matches , and it caught for a minute , and then went out with a sudden little puff . ‘ Paper — paper is what [I]273-mary want , ’[273-mary] [she]273-mary muttered . ‘ [I]273-mary wonder if love - letters burn better than other kinds of paper ? ’[273-mary] And , going to the table , [she]273-mary unlocked a drawer and took out a thick bundle of letters in thin , foreign envelopes ; all [Vincent]129-vincent 's letters during [his]129-vincent journey round [the world]318-the world . ‘ It is poetic justice , ’[273-mary] [she]273-mary thought grimly ; ‘ and then — [I]273-mary must keep nothing that will remind [me]273-mary of [him]129-vincent — nothing — nothing — nothing . ’[273-mary] So [she]273-mary gathered up all [his]129-vincent letters , even the last one , which [she]273-mary had received the day before [Alison]128-alison 's death , and laid them under the photograph . Ah ! now [he]129-vincent burned . First the boots , then the trousers to the knee , then to the trim waist of the frock - coat . But then it went out again , leaving [Vincent]129-vincent 's head and shoulders still there ; [Vincent]129-vincent 's face , with its slightly superior air , the orchid in the button - hole . How chilly it had grown ! A draught came under the chink of the door , and [her]273-mary bare feet , thrust into bedroom slippers , were deadly cold . Another match ; this time it was for good . First the orchid was licked up by the little blue flames , then the chin , the mouth , the eyes . Soon there was only a handful of blackened paper . Well , real life was like that . The love of [lovers]1612-lovers was a blaze , a whiff , a vain , fleeting thing . [She]273-mary looked at the little heap of fluttering paper , and saw , with [her]273-mary sane vision , [Vincent]129-vincent going back to [[his]129-vincent wife]1978-his wife . Yes , [he]129-vincent would go to [Paris]14-paris , and then [he]129-vincent would go back to domesticity in [[Queen]269-queen 's Gate]3117-queen 's gate . Next year there would possibly be [another child]1631-another child — [a boy]419-a boy , perhaps , in whom [he]129-vincent would take more interest . [He]129-vincent had [[his]129-vincent wife]1978-his wife 's fortune , and for sure next time [he]129-vincent would secure a safe seat in [Parliament]43-parliament . That passionate interview would soon be a mere episode to [him]129-vincent . ‘ A mere episode , ’[273-mary] [she]273-mary repeated to [herself]273-mary deliberately , as the white daylight came creeping in at the window . And now a draught , blowing down the chimney , rustled the handful of ashes and dispersed them with a sudden gust , while a ray of wan sunlight crept tentatively along the empty hearth . Late that afternoon [a slight figure]1634-a slight figure was to be seen toiling up to [Highgate Cemetery]121-highgate cemetery . [Mary]273-mary had to see [the stonemason]1635-the stonemason about the inscription on [[[her]273-mary father]1846-her father 's grave]1637-her father 's grave . [They]1638-they had written to say that some of the letters wanted re - painting , perhaps re - cutting . [She]273-mary found [the stonemason]1635-the stonemason sitting straddle - legged on [a high tomb]1640-a high tomb near , carefully scraping a marble anchor which had become dingy in the course of years . [The man]1927-the man clambered down and touched [his]1927-the man cap . [She]273-mary remembered [him]1927-the man well as [a freethinker]1642-a freethinker , and [a great admirer of [[her]273-mary father]1846-her father 's books]1643-a great admirer of her father 's books . [They]1638-they both looked carefully at [[the professor]308-the professor 's grave]1646-the professor 's grave . And , to be sure , the line — ‘ To strive , to seek , to find , and not to yield ’[1635-the stonemason] was almost illegible . The urn on the top was slightly askew . ‘ It gets all the wind and the rain , [you]273-mary see , [Miss Erle]126-miss erle , ’[1635-the stonemason] said [the stonemason]1635-the stonemason , gazing critically at [his]1635-the stonemason work . ‘ [[[Yer]273-mary father]3280-yer father 's tomb]3281-yer father 's tomb , it do stand so '[1635-the stonemason] igh . Soaks the clay , it does , and shifts [the graves]1649-the graves . Look at [that angel]1650-that angel with the trumpet over there . A bit squiffy , [he]1650-that angel looks , do n't ' [e]3282-e ? [Some of them]3283-some of them tombs '[1650-that angel] ave to be repaired constant . ’ ‘[1650-that angel] [I]0-i want this seen to at once , ’ said [Mary]273-mary . ‘[0-i] It 'll be a matter of five pound to do it up properly , [Miss]1651-miss , ’ [he]1927-the man said , after some consideration , and then [he]1927-the man added , in [[his]1927-the man apologetic workman]3284-his apologetic workman 's voice , ‘[1651-miss] and [I]0-i should n't like , for ' is sake , to skimp the job . Ah ! [we]3285-we ai n't got many like '[0-i] [i]0-i m up ' ere . ’[0-i] When [the man]1927-the man had gone , [Mary]273-mary stood for a long time there on [the little mound at [the top of the hill]1654-the top of the hill]1653-the little mound at the top of the hill . All around [her]273-mary was the joyous activity of spring - time . [Nature , who never ceases , who never rests]1655-nature , who never ceases , who never rests , was once again at [her]273-mary work of recreation . Once again the lilac - trees were burgeoning with waxen blossoms . Once again a thrush , somewhere among [that great city of sleepers]1656-that great city of sleepers , was swelling its brown throat with an amorous song . The air was loaded with the perfume of may ; a pair of swifts were circling and swooping against the tender evening sky . And in all this gaiety of [a new - born world]1657-a new - born world only [she]273-mary was to have no part . Henceforward [she]273-mary was to stand alone , to fight the dreary battle of life unaided . ‘ And [women]1964-women live long , ’[273-mary] came the ironical thought : ‘ yes — [we]1964-women live long ! ’[273-mary] The sunset touched [her]273-mary face , [her]273-mary hand , the flush of hawthorn above [her]273-mary head . At [her]273-mary feet , beyond the foreground of spreading trees , lay stretched out an ocean of [houses]3246-houses , softened , made vague with a silvery veil of smoke , and pricked by endless spires . Here and there [a blurred block]1659-a blurred block , [a monster hotel]1660-a monster hotel , [a railway station]1661-a railway station , rose out of the great sea of [dwellings]1662-dwellings . It was [[London]3-london that lay stretched out at [her]273-mary feet]1663-london that lay stretched out at her feet ; majestic , awe - inspiring , inexorable , triumphant [London]3-london . Standing alone , there on [the heights]1664-the heights , [she]273-mary made a feint as if to grasp [the city]1665-the city spread out before [her]273-mary , but the movement ended in a vain gesture , and the radiance of [her]273-mary face was blotted out as [she]273-mary began to plod homewards in the twilight of [the suburban road]1666-the suburban road .
